page.title: 06LIFE STYLES IN TRELAWNYD
page.content: Pant Glas Farm in Axton has recently changed hands, and is now a Riding School. The new owners have built well ventilated stables for ten horses and ponies A barn has been converted into a self contained flat, and people are now able to book for a weeks riding instruction. Emphasis is placed upon the correct schooling of the horses. A large are has been levelled off for Dressage use. The surface has been covered with stone chippings, plastic sheeting, and finally wood chipping to make an ideal space for disciplining both horse and the rider. Provision is also made for the horses to roam freely in the fields disturbed only by a large nest of rabbits. All the insruction is given under the guidance of experienced Riding School Instructors.
